required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Uterine Artery Embolization and Pelvic Floor Symptoms
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Uterine Artery Embolization on Symptoms of Pelvic Floor Dysfunction

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

clinical_study.source: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to determine whether women who are already receiving treatment for their fibroids (ie. UAE) demonstrate improvement in urinary symptoms and sexual dysfunction as well.

primary_outcome.measure: Urinary symptoms as demonstrated by questionnaires

secondary_outcome.measure: Sexual dysfunction as defined by questionnaires

arm_group.description: Women with symptomatic uterine fibroids scheduled for uterine artery embolization

study_pop.textblock: Women with symptomatic uterine fibroids who are scheduled for uterine artery embolization

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- female
- age 18-80 years
- symptomatic uterine fibroids
- scheduled for UAE
- Negative urine dipstick (negative result = trace or less for leukocytes & nitrites) or negative UA or negative culture (Urine dipstick is performed as standard of care)
- Available for 12-months of follow-up and able to complete study assessments, per clinician judgment
- Signed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age <18 or >80 years
- women who are unable to read and write English,
- pregnancy or planned pregnancy in the next 12 months
- < 6 months postpartum
- current use of anticholinergic medication, cholinergic agonists, tricyclic antidepressants, or duloxetine - must have been off such drugs for at least 4 weeks
- women with surgery for urinary incontinence or pelvic organ prolapse in the past 6 months
- history of bladder or pelvic cancer or pelvic radiation therapy
- prior augmentation cystoplasty
- urethral diverticulum, current or repaired.

overall_official.affiliation: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

facility.name: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center
